More Notes: This result represents the percentage increase in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to all eight tipping points combined.
This result represents the percentage increase in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to dissociation of ocean methane hydrates.
This result represents the percentage increase in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to permafrost carbon feedback.
This result represents the percentage increase in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to the disintegration of the West Antarctic Ice Sheet (WAIS).
This result represents the percentage increase in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to the disintegration of the Greenland Ice Sheet (GIS).
This result represents the percentage increase in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to variability in the Indian summer monsoon and associated floods and droughts.
This result represents the percentage increase in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to dieback of the Amazon rainforest.
This result represents the percentage decrease in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to the slowdown of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC).
This result represents the percentage decrease in the expected Social Cost of Carbon due to Surface Albedo Feedback (SAF).
